title: Legal eagles find fresh perch in Dexus tower
text:
Herbert Smith Freehills will cross the road at the top end of Melbourne's Collins Street to fresh lodgings in a new Dexus-owned tower, the latest in a line of top legal firms which are swapping digs in the next two years.

HSF will take up eight floors, or 10,300sq m, at 80 Collins Street, just a short walk from its current home at landmark tower 101 Collins Street. A 12-year lease has been struck, beginning in mid-2021.

Dexus took over the 80 Collins Street precinct for $1.5 billion. Supplied

The net face rent is expected to be some way above $850 per sq m, according to market sources.

The law firm will be joining other blue-chip tenants already committed to the tower, including premium tenants such as Macquarie Bank,

McKinsey & Company and DLA Piper.

"We are excited to be moving to a state-of-the-art building, which will support our plans and aspirations for our staff and clients," said Rodd Levy, Herbert Smith Freehills’ managing partner in Melbourne.
description: Herbert Smith Freehills has joined in a broader migration, with at least eight more of Melbourne's largest commercial law firms expected to move to new offices in 2020.
